content:
PR #7894 is feeling neglected.

From my point of view, this code is pretty stable — I've been working with it (i.e., building things on top of it) for quite a long time and didn't need to change anything within #7894.
I made some breaking changes (adding a simp lemma that @Floris van Doorn suggested). Can you please check that it is all right (apart from the test stuff that I must be yet fixed)?
We will probably add a bunch of simp lemmas. Does anybody object doing it all in a single PR?
Any simp lemmas that don't require understanding of VSCP to review (i.e., are not about VSCP itself) would probably do better in their own PR

Since I don't want to delay the VCSP stuff, I propose the following order of work:
(1) I keep @Floris van Doorn 's lemma in my PR but without the @[simp] tag.
(2) PR #7894 gets reviewed.
(3) After my PR gets merged to master, I'll create another PR, in which I add the @[simp] tag to @Floris van Doorn 's lemma and I add several other simp lemmas that will stop things from breaking after adding @Floris van Doorn 's lemma.
(4) The new PR (this time classified "chore" as opposed to "feat") gets reviewed.
I have just reverted the last few changes.
